sources: ['US20010003121A1', '0502', 'Prepared according to the method described in Example 69 from 2-chloro-5-(2-chloroethyl)amino-N-(tricyclo[3.3.1.13,7]dec-1-ylmethyl)-benzamide (0.1 g), ethanolamine (0.24 g), triethylamine (0.5 ml) and tetrahydrofuran (3 ml). Purification by flash column chromatography eluting with 10% methanol and 1% triethylamine in dichloromethane gave 2-chloro-5-(2-(piperidin-1-yl)ethylamino)-N-(tricyclol3.3.1.13,7]dec-1-ylmethyl)-benzamide as a glass. Conversion to the hydrochloride salt upon treatment with excess ethereal hydrochloric acid (2M) gave the title compound as a cream solid (0.056 g).']
stages: ['step 1:Prepared', 'step 2:Purification by flash column chromatography', 'step 3:eluting with 10% methanol and 1% triethylamine in dichloromethane', 'step 4:gave 2-chloro-5-(2-(piperidin-1-yl)ethylamino)-N-(tricyclol3.3.1.13,7]dec-1-ylmethyl)-benzamide as a glass']

sources: ['US20010003121A1', '3,5-Dimethoxy-2-methyl-N-(3-chloro-tricyclo[3.3.1.13,7]dec-1ylmethyl)-benzamide', '0548', 'A mixture of 3,5-dimethoxy-2-methylbenzoic acid from Example 67a) (0.15 g,) and thionyl chloride (2 ml) was heated to reflux temperature for 2 minutes before cooling to room temperature and concentratedunder reduced pressure. The residue was dissolved in dichloromethane (1 ml) and added to a solution of 1-adamantanemethylamine (0.104 g) in dichloromethane (5 ml) and triethylamine (1 ml) and the resulting reaction mixture stirred for 2 days. The reaction was partitioned between dichloromethane (100 ml) and aqueous hydrochloric acid (0.5M, 50 ml). The organic phase was washed with a saturated aqueous solution of sodium hydrogen carbonate (50 ml), dried over anhydrous magnesium sulphate, filtered and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by HPLC over a Dynamax® column eluting with iso-hexane: ethyl acetate (4:1) to give the title compound as a colourless solid (0.090 g).']
stages: ['step 1:A mixture of 3,5-dimethoxy-2-methylbenzoic acid from Example 67a) (0.15 g,) and thionyl chloride (2 ml)', 'step 2:was heated', 'step 3:to reflux temperature for 2 minutes', 'step 3 properties:Time:120', 'step 4:before cooling to room temperature', 'step 4 properties:Temperature:room temperature', 'step 5:The residue was dissolved in dichloromethane (1 ml)', 'step 6:added to a solution of 1-adamantanemethylamine (0.104 g) in dichloromethane (5 ml) and triethylamine (1 ml)', 'step 7:the resulting reaction mixture', 'step 8:stirred for 2 days', 'step 8 properties:Time:172800', 'step 9:The reaction was partitioned between dichloromethane (100 ml) and aqueous hydrochloric acid (0.5M, 50 ml)', 'step 10:The organic phase was washed with a saturated aqueous solution of sodium hydrogen carbonate (50 ml)', 'step 11:dried over anhydrous magnesium sulphate', 'step 12:filtered', 'step 13:concentrated under reduced pressure', 'step 13 properties:Pressure:reduced pressure', 'step 14:The residue was purified by HPLC over a Dynamax® column', 'step 15:eluting with iso-hexane: ethyl acetate (4:1)', 'step 16:to give the title compound as a colourless solid (0.090 g)']
